haxel.HxlQuadTree

type
class
extends
HxlRect
A fairly generic quad tree structure for rapid overlap checks. HxlQuadTree is also configured for single or dual list operation. You can add items either to its A list or its B list. When you do an overlap check, you can compare the A list to itself, or the A list against the B list. Handy for different things!

Static Variables

public A_LIST : Int

Flag for specifying that you want to add an object to the A list.

public B_LIST : Int

Flag for specifying that you want to add an object to the B list.

private _min : Int

These variables refer to the potential child quadrants for this node.

private _o : HxlObject

These objects are used to reduce recursive parameters internally.

private _oa : Int

private _ob : Float

private _oc : Dynamic

private _ol : Float

private _or : Float

private _ot : Float

Constructor

public new(X : Float, Y : Float, Width : Float, Height : Float, ?Parent : HxlQuadTree)
parameters
X The X-coordinate of the point in space.
Y The Y-coordinate of the point in space.
Width Desired width of this node.
Height Desired height of this node.
Parent The parent branch or node. Pass null to create a root.
Instantiate a new Quad Tree node.

Instance Methods hide inherited show inherited

public add(Object : HxlObject, List : Int) : Void

parameters
Object The HxlObject you want to add. HxlGroup objects will be recursed and their applicable members added automatically.
List A Int flag indicating the list to which you want to add the objects. Options are A_LIST and B_LIST.
Call this function to add an object to the root of the tree. This function will recursively add all group members, but not the groups themselves.

private addObject() : Void

Internal function for recursively navigating and creating the tree while adding objects to the appropriate nodes.

private addToList() : Void

Internal function for recursively adding objects to leaf lists.

public clone() : HxlPoint

inherited from haxel.HxlPoint

inherited from haxel.HxlRect
The Y coordinate of the bottom of the rectangle. Read-only.

inherited from haxel.HxlRect
The X coordinate of the left side of the rectangle. Read-only.

public getRight() : Float

inherited from haxel.HxlRect
The X coordinate of the right side of the rectangle. Read-only.

public getTop() : Float

inherited from haxel.HxlRect
The Y coordinate of the top of the rectangle. Read-only.

public overlap(?BothLists : Bool, ?Callback : Dynamic) : Bool

parameters
BothLists Whether you are doing an A-B list comparison, or comparing A against itself.
Callback A function with two HxlObject parameters - e.g. myOverlapFunction(Object1:HxlObject,Object2:HxlObject); If no function is provided, HxlQuadTree will call kill() on both objects.
returns
Whether or not any overlaps were found.
HxlQuadTree's other main function. Call this after adding objects using HxlQuadTree.add() to compare the objects that you loaded.

private overlapNode(?Iterator : HxlList) : Bool

parameters
Iterator An optional pointer to a linked list entry (for comparing A against itself).
returns
Whether or not any overlaps were found.
An internal function for comparing an object against the contents of a node.
